intro: Nemophila erodiifolia, commonly known as the purple mountain mint, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces clusters of small, lavender to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving them a velvety texture. Nemophila erodiifolia thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and meadows.
